result.execSummary:
The defendant John E Riedel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

3 CASES:  15CM380, 16CM369 & 17CM3:  Defendant John E Riedel in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Per Atty Burger:  15CM380 already found guilty & prepared for Sent.  State to then dismiss and RI other two files.  Per ADA in compliance with VR.  JOC is entered in 15CM380.  16CM369 & 17CM3 RI and dismissed w/prejudice and w/o costs.

Sentencing:  15CM380 -  I/S 45 days in PCJ, subject to GT and work release.  Probation 1 year.  AODA and follow, fine/cost of  $265.60, with $200 DNA surcharge payable thru probation.  If not paid at end of probation, civil judgment.  9:10 adj.  9:11 back on record - cash bond applied to fines, return balance to poster.
